title: CASE MANAGEMENT MEETING: What do I need to do prior to meeting?
question: I have been sued for breech of contract and failure to pay credit card bill . I am in the process of filling and serving the opposing party with a Case Management form CM 110 . I need to meet and confer with the attorney . ( 1 ) How do I do that ? What do I ask him ? ( 2 ) When I filed my answer to the law suit , I asked for proof that I owed debt and stated that I was NOT served papers ( I found out about law suit because a third party sent me a letter stating that they got my info . public records and that they could help me with this case ) what form do I use to request documentation that this is my debt ? ( 3 ) will the credit card company be sanctioned for not serving me papers ? THANK YOU
answers: For a case management meeting have a summary of the current status of the case and what the parties plan to do in the future. To meet and confer simply call up the opposing party's attorney and discuss the case and whether it can be settled. To request documents a discovery request is necessary. A discovery request lists the type of documents or information needed and it is served on the other party with a deadline. If this is done properly the other party must comply.
You have received some great responses. I would recommend you get an attorney to represent you. Litigation is complicated and you coud get lost in the procedures. Good luck.
